Had several sammiches here, and can't complain about one of them.  It's obvious they use quality (Boar's Head, I believe) meats and cheeses in the sammiches, and the menu is a shmorgasboard of creatively constructed sammich creations.  They definitely aren't shy about layering the meats thick, either.  

Service has never been overly friendly, and many times outright rude.  I won't let that deter me from enjoying a quality deli sammich though, especially since this place isn't a sit down table side service deli anyways.  If you can put up with rude service for 30 seconds, you're golden!

This place has some wonderful sandwiches. I work in the building next door so I frequent most of the dowtown (or as they call it uptown) establishments during the week.  They offer Boar's Head and normally offer a daily or weekly special.  This place gets a 2 b/c they have the worst customer service, the unfriendliest staff, and got a 94.5 on cleaniness rating. Although the sandwiches are good its not worth having some lady bark at you for your order before you can even see the menu.  They need to hire some people that can smile.

I was looking for a new sushi spot, but was somewhat disappointed with the experience. First, I was the only customer, during my entire dining experience..which somewhat scares me. I was seated and served a complimentary salad. The salad was good, but overdressed..crazy overdressed. I ordered the onion soup and egg rolls. The onion soup was basically broth with a few onions, but no real onion flavor, which is what I was hoping for. As for the egg rolls, can I say frozen.
Onto the sushi. I chose a roll based on the waitresses recommendation, however it had a mango sauce that was so overwhelming I sent it back. I was not offered anything else and was charged for the roll, $13.95, after eating only two pieces. I questioned the server about being charged and she expressed the fact she told me what I was getting and I ordered it. Whoa, was I surprised. I expressed my disappointment and said please do what you need to do. She disappeared and came out with an older women. Upon returning to my table she did remove the roll, but was very unpleasant about it. 
Although I appreciate the fact they removed the roll, but was not impressed otherwise and will stick to my other favorites.
Between all of us, shumai, gyoza, spicy tuna, dynamite, udon and other items, all were utterly delicious.  Will be back again for sure!

I really fell in love with this place.  Friendly atmosphere family owned restaurant was awesome. The pricing is average for Japanese food. I would recommend this place. The staff was so welcoming and I learned so much about their history

When you love your clothes, you need to find a dry cleaner you trust. I can't tell you how many times I've had garments ruined - buttons go awry, seaming comes loose, hemming done unevenly. It's a sad, sad day when your dry cleaner screws up your favorite (insert item of clothing here). Thankfully, I trust Rosa and the crew at Eden Cleaners. They love my clothes almost as much as I do - and that's saying a LOT. 

I have thrown just about everything Rosa's way, including alterations, hemming, dry cleaning, pressing, etc. You may pay a bit more here, considering the convenience factor of Uptown. But they do a fabulous job and it's super easy to park in the garage, hop out and enter in "650" on the key pad and someone will let you in through the back door. Easy peasy! *I've also heard that they deliver dry cleaning in the Uptown area but haven't used that service myself. *

In more than three years only two garments have come back less than perfect and Rosa offered to fix them free of charge both times. They are quick, professional and downright sunny every time I walk in. Oh, and she's remembered my name since 2007 and often asks if I've been working out more. Um, I love you Rosa.

So, bring your favorite garments over to Eden Cleaners, they will take great care of them...and you.

In terms of dry cleaning I don't require much.  Be quick, get the starch right and don't break my buttons.  Oh, and if you could crack a smile while waiting on me that would really be great.  This place get 2 out of those 4 done very well and the other 2, not so much.  I drop off 6-7 items on a Wednesday and they won't be ready till Saturday at 5pm? Come on, maybe I've been spoiled but any more than two days is stretching it.  Then there's the gentlemen working the counter, I realize his English may not be great but smiles are free and multilingual....try it sometime! Make me at least feel good and important about waiting 3+ days for Pete's sake.  Maybe he just needs a bit more talking to, to warm up....we shall see.

I don't trust Eden Cleaners. 

I used their online service to pick up my laundry. For three days no one called or picked up the clothes. After several calls, I finally spoke to someone. Clothes were picked up and returned. Their service was fine.

What bothers the snot out of me is that no one answers the phone as "Eden Cleaners". After they say, "hello?" I have to ask if I've reached Eden cleaners. I can deal with the very broken English, but I can't deal with the non-conventional ways of answering the phone or doing business online.

While it's more expensive to have the clothes done at the hotel, at least I know that they'll get done.

I went to this cleaner for convenience. What a mistake it was. They absolutely destroyed my favorite dress. It went in perfectly fine and came out pink! The woman told me it was not her problem and that they weren't a magic shop! Absolutely terrible service. I have had the dress cleaned before with absolutely no problem. Use at your own risk.

City Tavern is an attractive restaurant in the heart of uptown Charlotte. They boast a nice menu with a great seafood selection, so we gave it a shot. For starters, we went here on a Saturday night at 8pm and were practically the only ones inside, which is never a good sign. I ordered a mojito, which was really good and refreshing - one of my favorite parts of our experience there. 

I ordered the seabass and it really wasn't anything spectacular. This is definitely one of those restaurants that gets the job done, it is clean and the food is OK, but I would probably wouldn't think to go here when looking for a good restaurant on a Saturday night. If you do head over, look for my second favorite part of our experience, our waiter. He was so cool and absolutely hysterical!! I can't remember his name, but look for the guy who looks like Dave Chappelle. You'll get dinner and a show.

Okay, seriously I do live close by, but the food is pretty decent here and I really like the double deck outdoor seating when its not too hot.  Good draught beer and we never seem to have to wait too long.  

Try the ahi app and the blackened seafood for dinner.
Closed down

I visited Charlotte and decided to go here, cause it was crowded. The wait was 35-50 minutes. I really didn't know what to choose --- so i end up ordering Beer Battered Fish and Chips (os os) and the ribs and chicken combo w/ fries (os os). There was nothing really special about the food. Charlotte doesn't have much to offer when it comes to food =P

It's rock bottom, you know what you're gonna get. We have this in DC and San Diego. 

Friends kids loved the pizza and fruit cup. Most even stayed on the table and not on the floor. this was a major accomplishment.  The milk and apple juice must have tasted great as well as they both had refills.

I had the Hawaiian Chicken which was really tasty, pineapple, rice pilaf and green beans.  Next time maybe something not "chainy", but this did hit the spot. no wait at around 7pm on a Monday. 

outdoor seating too - a+
not thrilling, not disappointing.  RB is average across the board.  Try the Hazelnut Crusted Chicken.

Ate here the other night and would TOTALLY go back. Very spacious, awesome bar and outdoor seating available. I had the Hawaiin Chicken dish - you have to try this, it was incredible! They chicken was so juicy and cooked perfectly, with pineapple sauce on top and rice pilaf underneath. I am craving it again as I type this. It is also very cool to walk into a place and order your beer by saying "red, ale, amber, port" etc. I will definitely be back.
We had a large group eat here on Friday and a few of us returned on Sunday. The food was great and so was the service. If you go ask for Phillip to serve you. It has a fun atmosphere.

Pretty good, not bad, but nothing I would crave or get excited about so, a solid 3 stars in my book. 

Friendly service and seemed like a good place for huge groups (there's no way any one there could have missed the giant family reunion here where everyone wore the exact same patterned clothing in shirt or dress form!) 

Food was good, pretty good pizza (too thin and floppy for me), jambalaya was pretty good, spicy, and was made with orzo pasta. 

Parking didn't seem like too much of a pain, there was a lot across the street and a garage attached to the building. Overall, it was pretty alright.
Nicest patio downtown. There are much better wait staff downtown. Get the beer or wine. Stay away from cocktails. Food = pedestrian.
didnt eat.. the pilsner was hopped to perfection along the lines of an ipa- brilliant

Rock Bottom probably has one of the best locations in uptown. Right on Tryon St. with a large dining area and excellent patio for people watching or watching the cars go by.

I don't remember what I ordered I think it was some sort of BBQ chicken and ribs. The food was pretty average, I didn't get to try the beer but I hear it's quite excellent. It's not that the food is bad, in fact I quite enjoyed my time here, but the selections available and food that came out were just not quite memorable. Maybe I would even call it boring.

I'd come just for the great atmosphere here. When you go to the bathroom you can see all the behind the scenes brewing behind a large glass window! The parking is free too which is nice, more to spend on food!

This place has a decent menu, it's executed pretty well, and they (of course) make their own beers. Too bad it's often packed to the rafters with "former frat boy turned middling banking executives who still listen to DMB on the side". I'm happy to eat there if I happen to be uptown and the crowd wants to... but I try to avoid it whenever I can.

Yes! Yes! Yes! If you are weak at heart...don't come here! Cause you wil experience multiple foodgasms!!! I was a fan before they changed the decor, and now it's that much better! 
My favorite app is the Artichoke and Crab Dip! 0_0 with the crosctini bread! OMG! Every entree has been deelish! They have it all from burgers, to salmon, to salads! All homemade...and we haven't even gotten to dessert yet (Which is also killer of course!). Seriously! Make sure a bed is near by after you waddle out of there! lol 

Melissa was our sever last night and she was super cute and super helpful! Great food! Great Service! Clean and Modern decor! Free parking! Descent Price! You just can't go wrong with this place! 

Complete and Utter Satisfaction! Guaranteed to please! Every time! ;)

I like bottom but I like there older menu better. For example I miss the sausage meatloaf vs the new turkey one they replaced it with. Doesn't wow me like the other did. They lose a star with this updated menu.

I never go uptown just to eat here, but if I'm already uptown I come here frequently.
Their beer is OK and they have all of the bases covered to suit beer tastes.
Their menu covers many styles.  I had the shrimp enchiladas the other day and it really hit the spot.

I've been here with groups and have received good service and the checks have always been accurate and the food is always served with a smile.
Parking is convenient in the lot right below and they validate.
The waitress was awesome. Thanks Victory for telling us your secrets. Rock bottom is a really good chain. the difference is in the service when visiting one of these places.
I wasn't impressed with this place. The menu sounds really great& the waitress suggested I get the chicken bacon Mac & cheese, but it was disappointing to say the least.

Go here if you enjoy waiting in the lobby when there are tons of open tables and being rudely treated by the hostess!  The food is just ok bar food.  The beer is awesome I will admit and the servers are pretty attentive.  I would rather drive down to Myrtle beach or Atlanta to it's sister restaurant Gordon Biersch.  The food is much better and the people who work there will treat you much better.  If you really need to go there to enjoy the beer, I'd eat elsewhere and then just sit at the bar.

Visited Rock Bottom at about 4:45 on a Saturday.  Was surprised at how busy they were but we were still able to be seated quickly in a large comfortable booth overlooking the street.

I started with the Summer Honey Ale.  Meh.  I think I was expecting a bit more of a sweet/honey flavor.  I wish I had tried one of their other beers.  It comes in a large glass (I think bigger than a typical pint serving).

I had the stuffed poblano peppers.  I was curious (dubious?) so I asked my server.  She said that the filling is awesome and that the bites with the peppers had a kick.  She was spot on.  I really enjoyed the cheesey, chicken-y, chorizo-y filing.  The rice around the peppers was good too and it definitely seemed like a hearty portion.  Eventually, with sweat running down the side of my face, I scraped the remaining filling out of the second pepper and just ate it.  I enjoyed my pepper bites but was ready to stop the heat.

Our group shared some of the ice cream sandwiches.  Childish?  Yes.  Tasty?  Surely.  The plate comes with three ice cream sandwiches made with chocolate chip cookies, some strawberries, and a bowl of chocolate sauce.  My only wish was that the cookies were a bit softer.  In texture and look, they were over done with just lent additional difficulty to eating the messy treat.

Our server was very good and took excellent care of us.

yumm yumm yumm... Rock Bottom has some great food and the atmosphere is really cool. I love the fact that you can view the brewery and the beer sampler was fantastic! I don't have one bad thing to say about this place. Every one was very nice, they gave us time to actually enjoy our appetizer before our entrees came, and the food tasted absoutely amazing! I will definitely be back soon!

Had lunch here with my girlfriend and her young boys after Discovery Place.  I had the Mac and Chicken - awesome.  She had the ahi tuna salad - which she said was delicious too!  It wasn't crowded at all - service was pleasant and the boys gobbled up their buttered noodles.  I had the Rock Bottom IPA - pretty good beer.  Overall we were very happy with our experience.

3.5 stars.  Nothing special, but everything was fairly well done.  Went for a lunch meeting and had the southwest salad.  The jalapeno ranch was made in house and was great.  The baguette on the side was a nice touch.  Service was perfect: attentive but not hovering.  We were able to get in and out quickly.  Other diner thought the ahi tuna salad was good as well.  Tuna was perfectly done and contained a good sized lunch portion.  Other meals (chicken avocado sandwich and bacon cheeseburger) looked uninteresting.
Average bar food, nothing to write home about. Corn tortillas average salad. Average...just average. Go support a local place that offers something different

This place wasn't bad.  If you live in Charlotte and have tried the other local beers in the area, check this place out.  If you're from out of town and want good local beer, I'd recommend somewhere else.  While the beer was good, it wasn't memorable.  The food was good, but again, nothing super memorable.  The waitress was friendly and attentive.

This place has a mixed Menu..I had the 2am Burger which was very delicious and I was extremely full afterwards.  It had Bacon, hashbrown and a fried Egg for the topping. ..hence the name 2am. My Mom had the Fish and chips which were also tasty.  The sauce that came with it I could of skipped. The Fries are regular shoestring fries and nothing spectacular. They do bring Malt Vinegar to the table to doctor them up. We watched the World Cup game so it was a bit busy however our food was out in 15 minutes and yes the fries were hot!.  The waiter was helpful with the menu items and very pleasant.  I will definitely be going back to try the Stuffed Peppers which came highly recommended.

I have been to several Rock Bottoms including Denver, CO and this one was less than impressive. I'm new to Charlotte so I've been waiting to try this Rock Bottom out.  Went on a Sunday afternoon around 5pm. I took my young son with me so it was just dinner no alcohol. The restaurant wasn't very busy so we got seated right away.  Our server (which I didn't get his name) appeared about 5 minutes after we got seated, got our drinks and then we ordered.  We didn't see him again until after our food was brought to us. We only saw him twice after he checked to see if we had our food, and one of those two times was to hand us the check. The food was so-so.  My son had a hamburger which was delicious - my chicken bruschetta was fair but cold and the broccoli had no butter, seasoning, nothing.  It was over priced for what the meal consisted of. I gave two stars because  I was disappointed mainly with the service more so than the food. I've never had bad service or a bad meal at the Rock Bottoms I've been to in the past so was expecting the same high standards that I'm used to.  Might try again, but it will be a while.
I am never disappointed with their beer, food , or service. I have visited Chicago and Long Beach and now Charlotte always great and consistent.

The beer was pretty good, but the food was a real disappointment.
I have always enjoyed the beer at Rock Bottom and miss their location in Atlanta (Buckhead).
We sent back the guacamole because it was warm from sitting under a heat lamp.
I had the pizza and it was mediocre at best.  The wings were fine, but nothing special.  The restaurant was busy, but wasn't packed.   Our food took a long time to come out.  We were sitting near the kitchen and could see a number of items sitting under the heat lamps for 15 minutes.  It seemed like the kitchen was putting the food out fast enough, but the servers weren't getting the food to the tables.

Just got back from a week long trip to Charlotte with my girlfriend and of all the places we went to, this was our favorite by FAR.  EXCELLENT beer, food was delicious, steak cooked to perfection, wait staff was attentive and polite.  Just a great experience! If you're in Charlotte, got to Rock Bottom!!

What can I say? This is by far my favorite place in Charlotte. Period. I have been going to RB for over 12 years and still love it every time. The Artichoke and Crab dip is the best thing on the menu and the IPA is just outrageous. The staff is very friendly and the front and back patio is just plain awesome. I love this place and will continue to frequent indefinitely. 

High Recommendation!

I must say- this place, the food was really, really good. I probably would have given it 4 or 5 stars on the food alone. I ordered the grilled bruschetta chicken. Juicy and flavorful - excellent with the tomato and mozzarella. My friends' dinners looked really good as well- I had a bite of the bacon, chicken mac and cheese and the country fried chicken. Excellent food all around. 

The problem with this place was our waitress in particular. Korin. She started off really sweet and cool.... And then went B*TCH on our table of 6. A bunch of rude comments and all and all unpleasant experience. My friend had ordered the house root beer before and when she took a sip this time, the root beer was flat and watered down. When the waitress was told, she immediately got defensive and said "it's our house root beer" so excuse me, it is supposed to be watered down and flat? My friend then said she had the root beer before and it tasted different. The waitress decided to blame the soda machine and check and get her another. 

Her second mistake was when she came over to take our orders and said she would start with ladies first, the first lady she was talking about was chatting and the waitress said, "um, can someone tap her..."

The last and final mistake was that she mixed up all of checks or credit cards, I don't know what happened because when our cards were returned to us, we all had been charged the wrong bills! She didn't seem to know what to do, except suggest to run the cards again. But BLAMED US for the mix up and that we put our cards in the wrong bill. No! Rude rude rude!!!!

On our way out, I guess she had told the manager to cover her own behind. 

I would go back for the food and that's about all I was happy with.

By far my favorite restaurant to eat at in all of Charlotte! I refuse to try anything other than their fish tacos! Everyone that I have visited the restaurant with raves about their burgers but the fish tacos are by far the best I have ever had! The beer that is brewed within the restaurant/brewery is also delicious and I make sure to get the beer sampler every time I go so that I do not have to pick just one. The atmosphere is also a huge highlight. Part of the restaurant is a laid back, sports bar type of restaurant while the other half has a swanky feel to it. You can definitely go in jeans and a t-shirt or dressed up for a night on the town and be comfortable. The bathrooms are always cleaned and are regularly checked and the service has never been poor. Sometimes, I consider driving the 2 hours just to go! Make sure to check out this place next time you are in Charlotte!

Came here 2 days in a row because RIRa didnt want our bar business.

The food and drinks here are great....and the wait staff is friendly.

We will be back

_The Music on Fridays is great!  Had the appetizer tostada, two small ones but the perfect size for me. The corn tortilla was tough in the middle otherwise great.  Service was a little slow. .. They were busy.

Would have given 5 stars for the food, but the air seemed to be broken and the service was extremely slow. Half the time our drinks were empty. Our appetizer didn't come out until our food did... So what was the point in an app??? If you can stand sweating the whole time and being thirsty then come eat here because the food is amazing.

This place is incredible!!! The beers & the food is excellent & outstanding!!! The Service is Wonderful & Amazing!!! Hospitality & Generous Portions & A Staff that seems to Genuinely Care if you enjoy your experience there!!! If there was more than 5 Stars Available I would offer more to Rock Bottom Brewery!!! First Class Establishment All The Way!!!

Beer: Just Ok
Service: Timely and friendly
Food: My expectations were a bit higher. I ordered the Cajun fish tacos. (Highly recommended by the bar staff) More lettuce than fish, to much of the sauce, came with rice that was not fully cooked, along with beans that were cold and topped with chopped chives. Overall the tacos tasted like something from Taco Bell and the sides were all I could salvage of the meal. Friend had a chicken sandwich that was clearly re-heated chicken, stale bun, one slice of avocado and soggy fries. 

Apparently people love this place. I'd come back to have a beer and an appetizer but probably stay away from the rest of the menu. Over priced and overrated!
I love Rock Bottom Brewery!!! I would go to 2 of them in San Diego & La Jolla... Awesome!!! The Charlotte One is even better & Bacon Mac & Cheese is why!!! #Culinary Greatness!!!

This is a really nice place! They have a nice variety of food and cocktails. My man always wants the bacon Mac n cheese and I enjoy the Cajun pasta. So many good things about Rock Bottom. Try them out!

How do you not noticed that one of the people at the table did not receive their meal. The waitress who took the order said, well, other people delivered it. She took no responsibility.
I asked specifically if the lobster and shrimp tacos had pieces of lobster in it. The waitress said yes. There were tiny pieces of what looked like artificial crab. No lobster. 
One of our party had Caesar salad. Caesar salad should not be too spicy to eat. 
I'd give it zero stars but Yelp won't let me.

Our visit to Rock Bottom was a very nice to way to end a day of travel into Charlotte.  A tasty meal, a good beer, and a nice place? Check ,check and check.. almost.

The food was good, but nothing incredibly memorable. The asiago artichoke and crab dip appetizer was very tasty, but our burgers were nothing special.  I ordered their house beer, which had a nice flavor to it and went well with the food.

The restaurant itself has a nice brewhouse/restaurant atmosphere to it.  Servers were quite nice, and the service was prompt and efficient.  Personal tip: the outside patio is great during the daytime to watch the activity of downtown Charlotte, but after it gets dark, the people walking around get a lot sketchier.  Since your tables are next to the sidewalk, some of the nighttime folks may start messing with you.  Be warned.

Overall, though, this was a nice place to go and wouldn't mind going here again.

I had a good experience.  I came with family and everyone enjoyed their meal.  I can't say it was spectacular, or that it's a must whenever I visit the area, but overall a good meal.  Oh and they'll validate your parking so thats a plus.
I have eaten here several times & always find it disappointing. Tried a variety of foods & none have been particularly good.

I enjoyed my time at Rock Bottom. I had the fish and chips. My husband ordered stuffed peppers, and my friend had a chicken and avocado sandwich. All of us were pleased with our food. My husband was especially pleased with his stuffed poblanos.

All three of us ordered beer flights. I liked everything except for the IPA, which is normal for me (I'm not a big fan of IPAs). My favorite was the Black Velvet Lager. 

Our server was on point. I was never left waiting for water refills, and he was friendly and efficient. Overall a very pleasant dining experience.

One of my favorite places in Charlotte! Located 31 floors above the heart of Uptown at the corner of Trade and Tryon, it's possible to not know that the City Club exists.  The service, the food, and the ambiance is first class! The views of the city are spectacular, especially at sunset. I love to watch the sun set from the Stonewall Jackson Room as the planes at Charlotte Douglas International Airport take off in the distance.  The views of the city are probably my favorite feature of the city club.  The Charlotte City Club is more than a place: it's an experience!

We were married here 5 years ago and have been members since.

Physical facilities - Some areas have recently been renovated and the "maze-like" layout that some writers have mentioned has been reduced.  The view at sunset is incredible and they have added 2 and 4 top tables to take advantage of that in the past year. From the 31st floor you can look out and see some mountains in the distance

Service - A number of reviewers have commented on the experience from a wedding point of view and some for the single party meal experience.  When we planned our wedding, the event director, Nathan, was phenomenal.  The actual wedding... I don't remember what the service or food was like, I was too preoccupied with marrying the love of my life; but I do not recall any issues.  On a day to day basis, the service is outstanding.  From the day you join they refer to you by name.  How they remember everyone's name is beyond me but it is a very nice touch.  

Food - Menu is updated frequently, and frequent farm to table selections.  Gluten free and vegan options are identified discreetly as well as the old Southern favorites that have stood the test of time.

Experience - There is no where in Charlotte that comes close.  On special event weekends it is very nice to be able to get a table that is quiet and not jammed up against the next table.  Parking is available in the deck of the building.  Overall, I would highly recommend this club to anyone that works in Charlotte or like to frequent downtown events.

Now, don't think I haven't been anywhere. I have dined at elite restaurants as well as common places like this one. This location is very clean yet comes with a bit of a wait. The food is hot and fresh. The staff is very accommodating as well. They have not messed up my order.

Fast, professional,friendly service. I needed to be in and out on a schedule hectic day and they did just that. This will be my eye contacts place moving forward. They also validate parking. No issues all around.
Dr. Price Osborne is great.

I recently visited this eye doctor after moving to the area, and had a great experience. I saw Megan Price Osborne and she was super friendly and thorough. They offered convenient appointment hours for me to stop in over my lunch hour. I had to go back to work right after so I couldn't have my eyes dilated, they said to come back whenever I had time for it, so I did and it was fast and easy. The staff has been friendly and helped me fit my glasses on several occasions, even though I hadn't purchased them there. I would definitely recommend this place from my experiences so far.

So, I read numerous reviews on different eye care centers in the Charlotte area before finally deciding on one. 

I saw that Spectrum Eye Care center in uptown Charlotte had the highest rating. 

I decided to try them out and the reason they're so highly recommended was made clear! 

Their staff was very friendly, professional, fun, cheerful, and eager to help me. 

Dr. Osborne was fun, friendly, helpful, thorough, professional, and very very smart with regard to her chosen profession! 

This will be my eye care service provider for as long as I choose to stay in Charlotte!

So far, they've won my business! 

Keep it up and Thank You so much for being awesome, Spectrum Eye Care team! =)

I had a great experience with Spectrum at the uptown location. From my first phone call to schedule an appointment as a new customer to my yearly exam, the staff and doctors were courteous and extremely professional. My appointments were on time and they treat every patient with honesty and respect. I would definitely recommend Spectrum.
Excellent service, very little wait times and knowlegable Doctor, staff and optical specialists.

I chose to go here after the stellar reviews I read on Yelp. I am glad to say that its all true. Everyone was friendly, especially Dr. Eric. The eye exam was actually fun and informative. I am recommending you guys to my friends. Keep up the good work!
Dr. Price provided an a professional opinion regarding my vision correction.  One of the reasons I chose Spectrum was due to the Yelp reviews!  I will recommend you to my associates and friends.

Reasons for 5 stars:
1.  Uptown lunch=6 bucks.  that's freaking awesome
2.  Nice staff/owners/customer service- very friendly, insanely fast
3.  The tempura chicken = Adult happy meal...was the best feeling ever to be 6 again with chicken nuggets and bbq sauce..plus the rice and salad...awesome

4.  I genuinely liked the food.  

The staff was also fast and friendly.  I would take this over the superyuppified trendy salad place

I found this place it was cool and close to my hotel. I got the fried chicken ,Mac and cheese, Collards and rice and gravy.  I'm going to gym right after to work this off. So I can indulge in this down home southern cooking

This is part two of my review I came back the next day for lunch because the food here is so so so good. I got he smothered cube steak with rice ,Mac and cheese, and those lip smacking Collards greens. I wish I could box up this food take some back to Atlanta.  I must say I will make a stop here at Simmons whenever I'm in Charlotte.  This has got to be the best soul food restaurant in Charlotte.  And its priced right very economical.


This food was so good , I went back the next day for lunch...

Simmons is a small family owned restaurant tucked away in 4th Ward that has been around at least since 1989 or 1990 (I think that is when I first discovered it).  They know how to cook up some southern fried goodness - their fried chicken is some of the best in the city.  I can't resist their mac-n-cheese or sweet tea either!  If you happen to save room, don't forget the peach cobbler for dessert!

Well I must say if you are looking for some "REALLY GOOD" Soul food, stop by this place. I had the sweet tea, fried chicken (seasoned just right) collard greens and candied yams. Somebody's "big momma" is in the kitchen cooking it up right! And to  top it off the banana puddin' is THE BOMB!

Just had dinner at Presto earlier and I am STUFFED. For those of you hummus fans, you need to get this as an appetizer, it is excellent. Comes with warm pita slices for dipping, and a side of yogurt sauce as well. Delicious. 

The atmosphere here was great, not a huge place but lots of room and they were accomodating two large parties at the time we were there. I ordered the flounder and shrimp francese, over creamy risotto with asparagus - PHE.NO.ME.NAL!!!!! This dish was so good I literally could not stop eating it, even when I abslutely could not fit anymore. I probably should have stopped, but couldn't. 

My one reason for keeping this from being a 5 star restaurant was the heat - it was so warm in there, we literally could not wait to get out of there. And that doesn't say much considering it was just as hot outside. But it makes it difficult to fully enjoy a meal when you are breaking a sweat eating it. Maybe we went on a bad night. Either way, we are definitely going to go back here, it was excellent, even down to the ambiance and service.

I'm really trying to branch out more into Uptown...ye though I walk through the valley of death...oops, I digress.

The Hubbs and I had a guest in town and he suggested we eat here.  I happened to take a chance on this place, without consulting Yelp, and I have to say I'm glad I *again* (see Golden Taipei) went out on blind faith!!!

I got the Ravioli Pecca-something-Italian-sounding and it was tasty!  Had those cute, broccoli and sun-dried tomatoes...mmm mmm!  My husband got some sort of roast beef sammie and the meat was cooked au jus. Needless to say, he was full and happy and our guest joyfully guzzled down some chicken wings (because apparently, where he lives in West bumble-**** Virginia no one makes chicken wings?! But, that's another blasphemy for another day).

What makes me a fan is the fully-loaded bar and drink selection.  Our waitress made a wonderful recommendation based off of how I was feeling (Libra Love: Crown Royal, Malibu Rum, Pineapple juice, and raspberry something-or-other...can you tell it worked?) and I appreciated how she kept the rounds coming (our guest enjoyed Jack & Coke).  The atmosphere was pretty chill and they can cater to larger parties, so I'm already thinking about some type of girls night outing including Presto!

This would also be a great date night spot (reserved for pay day weekends)

I want so much to give Presto 3.5 stars as a result of the great service...but will stay with 3 stars!  My KB After Dark Crew had it's quarterly get together at Presto last night and everything was good.  The service was oustanding.  So...why not a higher rating....well.... when you have a large group and want to have a table full of appetizers...and cannot get chicken quesadilla....or mussels, it is disappointing! Those are two items we have come to enjoy at Presto!  Perhaps mussels are out of season? Well...are flour tortillas to make the quesadillas also out of season :-(.  Our crew will return....the drink specials were great....one person in the party did not like the rubbery steak wrap....but for the most part....they are worthy of another visit!   And I loved the Hot Mama....ohhhh that is pizza served with pesto and other wonderful fresh ingredients..so very good!  And...one of these days.... all restaurants will waive the fees to open a bottle of wine....and there will be no corking fee!!!  I love my wine...I don't like corking fees!!!

This place somehow gets a lot of people coming for the food. Personally though I have never eaten here this review goes over the hookah here which is awesome!

You can't smoke hookah outside so you'll usually be seated outside on the small patio, or upstairs on the 2nd floor. There's tons of flavors to choose from ranging from $10-15 which is a terrific value considering how long it lasts! The scenery around here isn't exactly the greatest even though it is downtown. Last time I was seated on the front patio and watching the cars go past and wondering how some people's eardrums weren't blown out by their bass we got pestered by the local homeless guy for some change. I think his name was Teddy, and he gave us a dance until the manager came outside and chased him off.

I'd probably suggest eating somewhere else and just coming here for the hookah. The menu looks positively bland, but the hookah is top notch, and the waiters are super friendly and even give me water and refill it regularly. I like that, also you should get the honeydew hookah. It's fabulous!

This place seems to be going a tad downhill. Super disappointed that the drink specials went up. The waiter was super nice, but the service was slow. If you do go, then sit downstairs...it seems that they had better service. Well drinks on Fridays are $5.00 and not worth it. Pizza was decent and the spinach artichoke dip was pretty awesome.
Very poor service. Unremarkable at best.

Tasty, if unremarkable, Chinese fare is what to expect from China King. You can get in and out quickly, even during the lunch crush if you go through the cafeteria type line and order. There you will find pretty standard items like General Tso's chicken, spicy pork, beef with broccoli, etc. Ordering from the menu gets you more variety but a bit longer wait. Food is good but not great and when they call something spicy, it's only mildly so most of the time. Pretty fair place to satisfy that MSG hankering when in uptown however.

This review is not only about this location but also the Old Statesville Rd, Huntersville and Clanton Rd.  Yesterday my car was struck at 3:40 pm, and I was informed by my insurance to give Enterprise a call.  I called the S. Tryon St location and no answer after 20 rings. So I called 9th Street, with a similar outcome, but was put on hold for more than a half hour and called the 800 #. After speaking to a woman she said the Clanton St location had cars.  I said "OK have them pick me up", but that location would not (It was too close to closing time).  I wasn't going to walk to that location, this goes against their motto that they will pick you up.  They must have banker hours, because if you actually get through at 5:30 they won't pick you up.  I decided to call the 800 # again and make a reservation for the next day.  I get the confirmation email and I thought everything was set for 11:30 the next day.  11:45 rolls by, so I call and It was the wrong location, as I thought I told the CSR the day before and Old Statesville transfers my "Reservation" to Huntersville.  I call Huntersville and they have no cars, I call back Old Statesville and they have no cars. So I call the 800 # again and the CSR tells me my nearest  location is the Airport! I do not live close to the airport at all, and the CSR would not listen to me.  I call the "Help Desk," and they weren't any help, I inferred "Bend over and bite this stick." This Company is the a great example of The Seinfeld episode They Can take reservations, but they can't keep reservations. Did they not know the DNC was in town and to prepare themselves? I guess not!  I will avoid this company and their false motto. Thanks for wasting 17 hrs of my life!

I stayed here for 2 nights while in Charlotte for business.  It's a very nice hotel.  The front desk clerk was very personable, friendly and accomodating.  My room was really nice and spacious.  I had a view of the city which was nice but I didn't get to really enjoy since I was not in the room much.  The bed... Heavenly.  The Westin is known for their Heavenly beds and it definitely was.  High thread count sheets and fluffy pillows... the best night sleep I've ever had while on vacation.  I thought about working out at the nice gym but the bed... couldn't get out of it.  Room service was good, but expensive.  $12 for pastries and fruit?!  Well it is room service and when is that ever cheap?  Had a nice stay and will probably stay here again if I have to come back to visit.

It's a Westin, you pretty much know the deal if you stay at them often- but they do vary a bit in terms of overall quality, though Charlotte leans a bit toward the low end for a Westin, I'm afraid. It is a sleek, newish building with the cool, polished feel that most Westin's throw down. The Ember Grille was nearly empty at dinnertime, and the environment was cold and stark. You would think something with "ember" in its name would emit a bit of warmth in its ambiance. The menu seemed a little limited, and we were starving and I was getting cranky so we actually opted for the bar for appetizers while we decided what to do. I highly recommend the "10" sampler, which included small bites of rare ahi, goat cheese quesadilla, buffalo wings, hummus and smoked salmon. Great deal for $14. J got a delicious Kobe burger and we relaxed in the spacious bar, and soaked in the cocktail hour jazz piano. Room service was just okay. The staff was all very pleasant with the exception of the disinterested waiter in the bar; strangest service I may have ever encountered. I think maybe he was trying to pull off some sort of NYC attitude schtick in Charlotte. It was amusing at least. Nice stay, nice location. No MSNBC, this and the waiter cost them a star.

Typically great Westin experience. I was able to get a room here for less than a Hampton around the corner, so I was stoked. I ended up getting to the room at 1am and was out by 7am, but it was a "heavenly" sleep!

Was here for the Manufacturers South Convention back in the spring this year.  Stayed 2 nights.  The biggest reason for selecting the hotel was the fact it is directly beside the convention center.  And upon arrival, it was clear this was the typical Westin experience.  

This is a really fine hotel.

Upon arrival, the head bellman was actually better than some bellmen at other Westins I have stayed in, and the staff professionalism continued to the check-in staff.  So that was a little surprise. The Westins near ORD, SFO, and DFW are not quite as polished in my opinion (but still good).

Had a room with a view of the city center.  Which was good, because this hotel sits just on the edge of downtown and just across the interstate in the other direction are strip clubs (so the quality of community drops of pretty quick).  But toward the city it is fairly close to good dining and nightlife.  No need to bother with a car unless you're headed out to get in a round of golf.

Parking fee was a bit steep, $25 per day for valet.  I think I recall $18 for self parking.  I actually ended up getting billed for both, but called and they took care of it.

Very nice in hotel dining and bar, as would be expected.  The bar is quite open to the lobby lounge with high ceiling.  And the bar staff are very easy on the eyes.  Additionally, the property is fairly new, so art and architecture feel very modern.  Rooms are nicely appointed and exceptionally comfortable.

I'm quite sure that when back in Charlotte I will stay here again.

I love this hotel. For some, it might seem too 'far' from downtown (3 blocks), but for me it's in great location. Walk to everything, including the Stadium, Convention Center, Downtown, and the Epicenter. 

Service is great - I would expect it! It's the Westin! From the time you get out of a scorching hot taxi (even with air conditioning on) up until the time you leave at 6 in the morning 3 days later. I haven't experience a single hiccup (except a spider in my bathtub that scared the hell out of me one night). 

Amenities are great:

Room - 4 stars. Last time I was here, I got a room with a great walking shower bathroom. This time, it was the regular small bathroom. Last time, my friend managed to get a room with a treadmill (yes, they exist!), this time they were all sold out. I got stuck on the 6th floor, she got stuck on the fourth floor. This was an upgrade for me, as last time I was on the 4th floor as well. Ok, enough bitching. The rooms are great. Beds are called heavenly for a reason and all the condiments and towels and sheets are so fresh you feel energized be mere being in the room. Air Conditioning is a bit loud so either turn if off for the night or bring ear plugs.

Gym - 5 stars. From the variety of the workout options to the gym facilities - everything screams class. Perfectomundo! Individual TV screens for every machine (bike, elliptical, treadmill) help time pass by while working out and watching "True Blood" on HBO. Hmmm. Plenty of channels to choose from, though. Sauna, showers, and the locker room are squeaky clean with plenty of extra shampoo, lotion and mouth wash.

Pool - 3 stars. Even though this is a great big lap pool, it's too shallow - only 3  1/2 feet deep. I understand that they don't want kids to drown there if unattended, but come on, waist-deep pool is not very appealing to me.

Ember Grill - 4 stars. I have only been here for breakfast - I can't complain, except for the prices. $18 for breakfast is a little steep. However, you can eat all you want from 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. and nobody will kick you out (not that I have done that, I swear!).

Business Center - 1 star. Ok, what they call a business center is actually a 50 square foot room with 3 workstations, a printer and a fax machine. Internet is pay-per-minute, except to check in on your airline's website and print the boarding pass (which was actually all I needed from the Business Center). However, for travelers who actually need a business center - better bring the laptop and stay in your room with $12.95/day internet service.

Airport Transportation - 5 stars. Checking out at 4 a.m.? Take advantage of the flat rate towncar that will take you directly to the airport. Air-conditioned bliss!

Ok, let's summarize: I would give this hotel a solid 4 stars and would definitely stay here again. Not because I have to, but because I loved it twice!

They must have read my review. Since my last visit, they remodeled the hotel bar and improved the seating capacity. The hotel restaurant menu was revamped and now offer an all-you-can-eat cold or hot breakfast with over 20 items to choose from. Much much better!

Also, several towncars and SUVs waiting outside to take you to the airport for a similar flat rate as a cab but far more roomy and stylish.

Don't waste your time staying here if you are a business traveler. The Internet is awful and they don't support iPhone or iPad 

So many better options around

I had a tremendously positive experience at this Westin (the 12th-ish or so I've stayed at this year).  

- Beautiful, very new-seeming property
- Great location pretty close to anything you'll need
- Reasonable prices on self-parking
- Excellent service
- Extremely clean, well-kept and comfy space (I was on the 22nd floor...so I suppose I can only speak for it)
- Upgraded to a corner suite that was amazing---very well appointed, functional and comfortable

Again, this is my 12th or so Westin stay this year---and it has been the best of all of those.

I stayed three nights at the Westin with a group for a conference. The staff was courteous in all of my interactions with them, which were few.  The room was tiny for the amount of money that we were paying, but it was clean. 

I was a bit upset that their website advertised in-room refrigerators, but the only fridge was the mini-bar which required a hotel staffer to open (and which was labelled as being 'not for guest items'). Having specific dietary requirements, I had planned on using the fridge to purchase small items that i could snack on during the conference that I was attending.  

I was also extremely upset at the cost of the dining options at the Westin, as well as the charges for *every* service that they offered.  This hotel was a bit of a splurge for me, even sharing it with some friends.  Two cups of coffee per room per day, extras can be purchased.  Internet (slow!) only available in the lobby, in-room you have to pay for it.  Ridiculous charges for room service, and the cost of the food itself was astronomical!  NINE DOLLARS for a bowl of oatmeal in the morning, or $20 if you wanted the breakfast buffet.  I would have been happy to pay $10-$15 for the breakfast bar, but $20 is way too much even for a 'resort' hotel.  

Next time a conference I'm attending is in Charlotte, I'll be looking at other properties in close proximity to the conference center or staying further out and riding the train in.

Stayed here while working the NASCAR race at the nearby Charlotte Motor Speedway. I'm glad the room was paid for by the company, as I don't feel like it was really a $170/night room. There wasn't anything wrong, particularly, but it wasn't "all that" either. The gym and pool looked decent. The bed was very, very comfy. Food (including room service) was WAY over-priced. 

The location right downtown, near the convention center is great. I would suggest taking a walk over to Brevard Court, near Church street to hit the little alley of bars and restaurants. They've got great atmosphere and reasonable prices (The Belfast and Valhalla in particular).
Heavenly Bed.  Nuff said

Spent 3 days at event. Room was comfortable. Bed was restful. 
Staff was very professional! Very helpful and ready to solve any issue. Oh, ask for Pattie in lobby bar. What a hoot! Loads of fun!
In short, good experience, great food at Embers Restaurant and nice room.

The Westin is your standard business traveler hotel in your standard business traveler city, (which is about as warm and fuzzy as I can get about the stepford city of Charlotte).  It has some really great aspects to it, and some less great aspects:

Good.  Great.  Grand, even.
1.  The fitness facility has a "club" feel with its low light, and has a good variety of equipment, ample mats, weighted balls, and stability balls.  What it's missing is a good machine for lats, but other than that, it's better than most hotel gyms.
2.  That darn bed is so comfortable I can't even stand it.
3.  Catering services from the hotel and their meeting space is well-supported, and well-done.  

Not so good.  Troubling.  Odd.
1.  There's a phenomenon out there called "sensory branding," and one of the ways to engage a customer's senses to get them to remember your brand is via smell, so the hallways are piped with smell.  A horrible, putrid, over-the-top, overpowering lavender-y spell is that so perfurme-y and strong that I literally coughed all the way down the hall to my room.  Having this be your welcome to your room?  I think not.  I held my breath the rest of the week.  
2.  The service in the lounge of the hotel is virtually nonexistent.  You'll see your cocktail server every 30 to 40 minutes.  This has been consistent through three different visits to the hotel and its lounge.
3.  The person who checked me in assured me of a great view.  The roof of the convention center is not/was not/will never be that.

(WiFi is free for Starwood Preferred Guest members, paid for others)

I'm giving this 3 stars because of the nice modern decor, and because of the fact that they always called us by our names when we called the front desk (I'm a sucker for that kind of thing).

We were in town for a comic book convention, so we got a rate of $119 per night. This still seems expensive, but it was a popular weekend so we didn't shop around much more.

The wait for the elevators was ridiculous! I guess that there's not much that can be done about such a thing, but waiting for 10 minutes at a time because every elevator that stops is FULL TO THE BRIM with people was annoying. At once point, my husband took the stairs back to our room WHICH WAS ON THE ELEVENTH FLOOR after visiting the Starbucks in the lobby. Oh, and it's not a full Starbucks so they didn't even have iced coffee...???

The room was nice- we were on the end of a hallway, which I had heard was good because of the views and tons of windows. There were a ton of windows, but they overlooked construction and highways. Meh. The shower/bathtub situation was pretty awesome, also with tons of windows (there were shades, if you wished to pull them down!). There seemed to be no fan in the bathroom, though, which surprised me. 

Also, there was a burnt out bulb in the bathroom, right near the magnifying mirror; when we called down to the front desk to have it replaced they said it would take them a while...and it did. Also, this is a small thing, but they put lotion in the shower instead of shampoo (next to the conditioner). So I washed my hair with lotion. Yeah.

We visited the bar on Saturday night between 10 and 11 and it was insane. It took us 40 minutes to get a drink, which we expected, but people behind us were being served first! I guess that's our fault for not being savvy enough to know how to get served in bars? Also, one bartender with red curly hair was making drinks kind of ridiculously- packing more ice in when she ran out of something and choosing things at random to pour in the glasses. We were glad the the person who finally served us (our overpriced cocktails) seemed to be measuring a little more carefully.

A few more details: Parking is $18 and they bill it to your room; pretty standard for a downtown Charlotte hotel, but not exactly a welcome charge on your bill. The pool is inside. Someone on Yelp said that there is a rooftop bar at the Westin, but they must have gotten rid of it because we were told there was no such thing when we asked.

In conclusion, I think I prefer the Courtyard Marriot a few blocks over, on Tryon. The location is a little better, the rooms a little cheaper, and the pool is outdoors (on a rooftop!).

There is a lot to like about this place. The amenities are very good. Starbucks in the bedroom, flat screen TV, a bed that's probably more comfortable than your own, clean bathrooms with toiletries you want to stuff into your bag each night, etc.

The only downside is this sneaking feeling that almost everything costs just a little bit extra. It seems ridiculous. You could go to a cheaper, less good hotel, and all the amenities and perks are complimentary. But here, at the Westin, it seems, if they don't get you in the wash, then they'll get you in the rinse. So far the only thing "complimentary" here seems to be the workout center.

So drop the cash and enjoy the comfort, just don't think about dropping the cash until after your stay.

Hubby and I like to hang out in Charlotte on the weekends, and this is definately a great hotel. If you want to relax - it is suitable, but if you want to people watch and have a great drink - the lounge works too! 

The rooms are always the same -  clean, cool and with a descent view of the Queen City! I have called ahead, and booked through the reservations line - and this is the only complaint I have. 

One time I visited, they did not have my reservation on file. The front desk obviously does not share the information that the main booking line has. They had actually reserved a room in Columbia, SC in error - then charged us for not showing up !? 

Everything was resolved a week later so we got over it! 

Also, if you stop in the bar on the way out, or just chill down there to enjoy the view -- you just might run into a celebrity. I refuse to name drop, but we have spotted a couple of celebrities there, and they are usually pretty friendly !

There are much better choices in uptown Charlotte!  Let me start with the good...the front desk staff. The three people who assisted me at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. Great customer service!

Now the bad...stains. There is no other way to describe everything in my room. Multiple stains on the carpeting and the comforter. The bathrobe hanging on the back of the bathroom door had a huge brown stain on the sleeve that I kept telling myself was makeup from the last occupant. Every, yes every, bath towel had a stain (either black or yellow). There was stained grout behind the toilet like it had leaked sometime in the past. Even the shower curtain was stained. Then there was the hair dryer. It was sooooo sticky that I didn't even want to touch it. It appeared to be covered in about 15 years worth of cheap hairspray. 

I can appreciate that the hotel is getting older and may need a renovation soon, but come on people!  How about you splurge and replace your bath towels and hair dryers now!  

Let me be clear that I think the cleaning staff is doing the best they can with what they have been given. They just need a better starting product!
Westins have the best bed linens...my room was a little too hot for me...air set to 64 and was still a bit warm.  Otherwise, very nice place.

Really enjoyed this place during a conference at the hotel for 600+ people.  Nice upscale appearance, very accommodating staff, and great breakfast and lunches for a big crowd all were reasons for my satisfaction.  Lastly, I requested and received a room with a "roll-in" shower to assist me with a chronic back problem.  That plus the comfortable bed minimized my back discomfort during the meeting.  BTW, special group parking rates and room rates were a great value added factor!  Great place for a meeting.  
Just one more thing, you can get takeout from the restaurant if you want to get around the in room fees for dining.

A beautiful hotel with accommodating staff and good amenities. The catering is splendid. The food is fresh and REALLY good! I don't need to say anymore than what has been said about the beds. Just the best there is. Bathrooms are modern and clean. Charlotte's beauty can be seen out my window. Stay here!

***The Westin Charlotte has a great location in Downtown Charlotte (within walking distance to so many key Charlotte attractions) and the hotel is contemporary and comfortable***

While I mostly stay at Marriott hotels, Westin hotels (of Starwood) are nice and typically more contemporary than Marriotts.  Westin hotels are also known for their comfortable beds though I personally do not notice much of a difference compared to Marriotts.  The Westin in Downtown Charlotte definitely delivered on Westin's contemporary image and comfortable rooms.

The rooms are not incredibly modern, but they are contemporary and have a simple and good neutral color scheme.  The design is definitely a notch above a lot of Marriotts that often feature an unappealing color scheme and ugly carpets.  The bed at this Westin was comfortable--excellent linen too and a comfortable room temperature.  The bathroom had a great look and featured a rainfall showerhead.  While I do not have status with Starwood, I did like the nice touch of two complimentary bottles of water with each night (it seems every Starwood member, even non-elite members, enjoy this benefit).

This Westin also has a great location.  It is right on College, which leads to several Downtown Charlotte restaurants and even some of Charlotte's nightlife like a dance club and a dueling piano bar.  This Westin is also within walking distance to several key Charlotte attractions including a minor league baseball stadium, the Carolina Panthers (NFL) stadium, the Charlotte Bobcats (NBA) arena, and the NASCAR Hall of Fame.

The fitness center was big and had several machines.

The lobby was nice too.  It was spacious and there were several sitting areas if you are waiting for someone.

I tried a little bit of their catering for a nightly event in their restaurant as well as in one of their banquet rooms for breakfast.  The food was definitely subpar for a Westin.  A lot of it was due to poor preparation and the effects of having buffet style food as the scrambled eggs were not that fluffy, the waffles were very soft and the flatbread was limp (it had definitely been sitting around for too long).

Service throughout the hotel was friendly though I felt that housekeeping was a tad slow to service my room on some days.

Prices are high, but the hotel is nice and the location is very convenient.

For travelers looking to explore Downtown Charlotte, this Westin is a great option.  The rooms are nice and the location is near perfect.  Downtown Charlotte is not my favorite downtown city.  It is a tad sleepy though not as quiet as Phoenix or as small as San Jose.  However, if you need to be in Downtown Charlotte, this Westin is a good hotel for a short or long stay.

Pay valet and self parking are both offered by this Westin.  It is easy finding a spot with self parking.

I can only speak from the experience of staying here for a recent convention. Several conferees and I had issues with the staff during the event over displays and services. Due to the nature of the event (romance novelists and readers) I got the impression they hovered close in case we decided to cause trouble. I did not find the venue pleasant.

While my room was clean, I think the bed aggravated my back pain. I also understand a number of conferees who drank the water experienced discomfort and sore throats.

I stayed at The Westin last week and I have to say it's not nearly as pleasant as it was a few years ago. 

Within 24 hours of my arrival my sinuses were freaking out. I thought maybe it was the climate change or the dry hotel air. But by day 2 my nose was bleeding and the person sharing my room was also not feeling great. It was then I noticed small mold spots in the shower. (there was no ventilation fan in the bathroom) I was there for a convention so I had to spend a great deal of time inside and by the time I checked out five days later I was miserable and so happy to get out of that hotel. 

The AC in the room also did not seem to operate properly. I'd wake up in the middle of the night hot despite the room temp being set on 64. No way it got near 64 or I would have been freezing. 

I fully believe the lack of ventilation and poor AC quality led to my roommate and I both ending up sick. But imagine my surprise when I get back home and complaints start popping up like crazy from dozens of the convention goers who also came home sick. I can't say for sure what the cause was, but I am comfortably saying The Westin in downtown Charlotte is not a healthy hotel. It needs some major work.
Beds are great and fitness/pool area is good, people are fantastic. The location was excellent, close to the baseball park, nascar hall of fame.

This has to be the worst "luxury" hotel I've ever stayed at. First off, I was staying here for a conference and had requested a higher floor room, but was given a 4th floor room - which is the lowest floor for rooms. I had also requested a King size bed since my wife was travelling with me, but we were given two double beds. In addition to not being able to sleep with my wife during the stay, I couldn't even fit comfortably on the bed (I'm 6' 4" so I always get a King bed). But I usually don't make a fuss about these kind of things when I'm at conference because I'm not paying for it anyway. The room itself was just okay - nothing wrong with it, but perhaps the most underwhelming room I've ever had at a supposedly luxury hotel. The only positive is that the bed itself was comfortable - would have been nice to have that King bed though, of course. 

Many of the hotel staff seemed rude and inappropriate in situations - including the onsite Hertz staff. Obviously management is not training well for customer service at this location. Plus I had went to the front desk to get my key card "keyed" for use in the parking garage because I had rented a car there, but they couldn't even manage to get this right. I never could get the key card to work in the parking garage. 

Conference rooms were poorly set-up, freezing cold, and loud! The walls were paper thin and it was at times very difficult to hear the presentations because sound from the other presentations next door would drift through - this was especially a problem in the back of the conference rooms. Attendees often were left standing at the back of the room because not enough chairs were set up.

Perhaps for Charlotte this is a nice property, but for those of us who have traveled around a bit, this place falls very far short on the luxury scale. If you are in Charlotte for travel and have an option to choose where to stay, I'd recommend the much nicer looking Hilton down the street - that's a nice looking property and Hilton is always good. 

Not recommended.

This is the one hotel in uptown Charlotte that I don't mind coming back to, since it meets my expectations nearly every time. Since arriving here for the first time for a convention in 08', followed b subsequent conventions and business meetings, the Westin Charlotte has been a welcoming accommodation that continues to leave an impression after each visit.

The first impression easily was the Heavenly beds. I've never slept in a better bed in a hotel prior to this visit, nor since. This bed set the benchmark so high with me that I purchased a comparable model a couple of years later at a pretty penny. The rooms within the Westin Charlotte are standard Westin: a littler smaller than expected, with the bed dominating a good portion of the space. The standard amenities of the pool area, gym and so forth met expectations. The front desk staff is very, very good, in addition to the banquet staff when it comes to accommodating colleagues that are in for a convention. 

The bar area across the floor from the front desk is one of my favorite places to network with professionals as much as I do drink. Known as "The Lobby Bar", the area is set up strictly as one to rendezvous with business associates and friends during events primarily after 5 PM. The menu is moderately reasonable for beer drafts, yet a little pricier for hors d' oeuvres and cocktails. If you can get your company to approve drinks and appetizers under T&E, it is highly advised. 

Parking is so-so. While the convenience to park within the underground lot is appreciated, I really think that it should be marked better with regard to where the elevator is in relation to the section of where your car is. It took me nearly 20 minutes to find my car at one point!

Altogether, the Westin Charlotte can be a place to really enjoy. A little pricey, yet worth it if you prefer a downtown (they call it uptown in Charlotte) location while either traveling or on business.

Couldn't me happier with my stay in the Westin!

I proposed to my girlfriend now fiancé and the staff here made it all the better. They helped me set up, sent champagne and nibbles and even gave me an upgrade so I could show my fiancé the best time of her life. Her staycation, our engagement, the whole experience was fantastic and I look forward to staying there again soon!

AVOID THE VALET AT ALL COSTS!

The valet curbed 3 of my 4 rims on my new BMW and refused to pay for the damages.

I checked in thursday morning which was great because I just got in from a redeye flight and it was 10:30 in the morning and they had a room available. Which I took full advantage of and took a nap before my sales conference started.  The room was very nice. I ordered Carolina pulled pork sandwich from their after hours menu. The person who brought the food up to my room said it was the best in Charlotte. Description said grain mustard Cole slaw and pickles. The coleslaw was a couple pieces of lettuce with some carrots. There were no pickles or grain mustard. Then the next night I ordered a turkey club and it is exactly what it said on the menu. The customer service is awesome but they need to  follow what their menu says. Other than that I had a great time. The channels are very scarce and it takes multiple seconds for the channel to change. Either the batteries are almost dead or its just terrible. We live in a time where tv is very simple. Their tv service reminds me of watching TV in the early 90's.

I aboslutely loved this hotel! My co-worker and multiple people I spoke to even mentioned how good it smelt- that's how you know it's a great hotel! haha no lingering smell of mildew or mold, it was so fresh and clean.

The beds were so extremely comfortable, i never wanted to get out of bed! They have a great service where if you'd like to skip your room cleaning for the day they'd give you a $5 gift card for going green.

This hotel also features a deal I've never heard of before and sadly didn't take advantage of.. You can rent workout gear for $5. They will send New Balance shoes and clothing to your room! for $5! Such a steal if you dont' have room in your carry on for extra items.

Amazing hospitality shown to our company FASTSIGNS, we were there for a Sales Summit for our FASTSIGNS store in Rochester, MN and the entire staff was incredible.  If I ever come to Charlotte, NC again this is where I will stay.  The rooms were clean, fabulous, and just overall a great experience.

It was a pretty nice place to stay. The first room I was given smelled strongly of smoke (it was a non-smoking room) and I asked for a new room. They gave me a new room and it was much better. Some of the rooms have this weird basin thing -- instead of giving you a sink in the bathroom, there's a sink outside the bathroom, with this weird tall basin that is hard to use. If you don't like the room with the weird basin, ask for a different one, because they don't all have them. 

There isn't a free breakfast, which is sort of weird, I think, and the room's supplies weren't as nice as some other Holiday Inns I've stayed at. The best thing about the room was that the clock-radio thing had a spot for your ipod, so you can listen to your music in the room (and it charges your ipod, too!). 

Amenities -- The pool on the roof is a uniform 3 1/2 feet in depth -- yeah, I know, exciting -- and not very big in terms of length and width, either. The fitness room features a few treadmills, a few bicycles, and a bowflex thingy -- not even any free weights! There is a "jogging track" on the roof, which is really just a path painted on the roof so you can run around in a circle on the hard concrete. It's really pretty up on the roof on a sunny day, but even the most hardcore runners in our group couldn't stand that running path. 

There wasn't anything wrong with the place. It was clean, comfortable, and centrally located, and the staff was very accommodating. I just sort of hoped for a tiny bit better, considering the price.

We had a great experience here:  helpful staff, clean room, comfy bed, free WIFI, and plenty of security.  My only complaint was that silly basin sink located at the entrance to the room.

This hotel is marvelously situated within walking distance to some of the best entertainment and dining in town.

GREAT LOCATION!  Very clean and very nice. Not the Ritz which is right around the corner, but for a Holiday Inn, the price was right and the property was flawless. Beds were comfortable and the area around the hotel is clean, and everything including great restaurants and entertainment in short walking distance.  Would have liked a couple of bottles of water, but there was a vending macing right down the hall.  We were greeted by a very nice valet, and when we entered the lobby, we were met by Adam!  Very cheerful, explained the area and had discount and freebie coupon's for almost everywhere in the vicinity.  Whatever we needed.....Adam took care of it.  Very cool and professional young man!  Definitely a place we will return.

I stayed at this motel for 2 nights (June 19th & 20th). The first morning I had 2 red spots on my right arm but just dismissed it. We stayed out all day & returned for the last night. I woke up Sunday morning with 15+ bites on me--mainly right arm & forehead. I called & talked to manger as soon as I saw the bites. She insisted that I was probably having an allergic reaction or I had picked up something outside!!!  The places were itching so bad. I checked the bed & saw a couple of reddish flecks on the bed skirt. When we checked out I spoke to manager & showed her my bites. She said they would shut room down(room 416) & have exterminators come in and let me know within 72 hours. On Monday I had 42 bites on me from my head down to my toes!!!!  I'm still waiting to find out what ate me up!!!!   No way would I EVER stay at this motel again.

JJ and the rest of the staff here are life savers! Missed my connecting flight because of previous delays and the airline set me up at the Holiday Inn Center City. 

After a $25 cab ride from the airport, I find out that the airline lost my reservation and I now have to pay full price for a room. I talk to JJ and the other desk staff and they get me set up with the original promised rate. Room was a dream (even though I was only there for ~5 hours) and I was greeted by name in the lobby the next morning. I'm not often in Charlotte, but I know I'll be back to see everybody here.

We went here after a meeting. Made reservations in advance.  We let them know we have a EMS dog due to my PTSD, they said no problem. Upon Check-in, we were told that they do not recognize PSTD as a disability, and our dog was not welcome. beware veterans, they do not acknowledge war.  No more.  PA...We have paperwork

Pluses: they have amenities you might see at a waterpark for a fraction of the price in a clean, well-run facility. They have food available at the snack bar ranging from a popsicle (25 cents) to large pizzas. They offer a "dry pass", a discounted ticket for adults to come in as chaperones and non-swimmers (and they have nice beach chairs lining the perimeter). The lifeguards and staff members are really, really nice.

Minuses: It can get CROWDED. It can get very steamy during those hot summer days. On the day we visited, the water was quite heavily chlorinated (or whatever the chemical of choice is these days). You can't bring your own food, and you can't go in and outside without drying off all the way and getting dressed. Those rules weren't followed by everyone, so if you followed the rules you would have been a little appalled at seeing the numerous occasions of rule-breaking. 

Good for 1-3 hours of summertime fun.

Sunday birthday parties are not my favorite thing, I mean what if it was a football Sunday?  Thank goodness it's not football season but my son could care less, he just loves a party especially if it involves water.  I think this place is a great party idea and of course you can come anytime as they're open all year............the perks of an indoor water park.  I've had great experiences here but my last was a little different as the chlorine seemed to be at a higher level than normal, and it was blazing hot.  I'll give them a pass as an isolated situation but I will definitely think twice before I return.

We went on a Friday and it wasn't too busy. We all had a wonderful time until the end. We were in the womens locker room and even though they had a family locker room there were little boys there about 6-7 years old changing in the room too and one walking around with no clothes on. I had my little sister and did not appreciate it at all. When I talked to staff all they asked me was if they had autism? It doesnt chnge anything.Come on there was a family bathroom right there. And they didn't seem too concerned about my complaint. And the bathrooms were nasty. But if you don't use the locker rooms or bathrooms it is good.

I use the MAC for lap swims.  They have 6, 7 & 13 foot lanes.  There are plenty of lanes and over a month of going there I haven't had to share a lane once but even if one did have to share, they are generous lanes with good marking on the flooring.  The water is cool; perfect for a workout but if one wanted there is a smaller warm pool as well. 

The great thing is that you can pay $5 as a county resident for single visits.  It's only a few dollars more for non-residents so if you are visiting from out of town and want to keep your training going, stay at the Hampton or the Hilton for easy access to the MAC.

I have to admit that the facility is old.  The locker rooms are grimy and dirty with old fixtures but there are plenty of lockers, showers, stalls and spacious to change out.  The number and size of lanes makes up for the small amount of time you spend in the locker room and outside of the pool.

Considering I'm staying at the Hilton this week and working at the AT&T building next door, the Coffee Station is the closest java joint to get my caffeine fix in the morning and during the 2 to 3 PM lull.

I must say that the several times I've been here so far, service has been incredibly friendly and they make tasty coffee.   I just had their breakfast sandwich and a large coffee this morning and the total for both was under 4 bucks.   Wow, really?   All I get for that at Starbucks is a lame scone.   And service here was far superior to the service I get at Starbucks.   The only thing I'll give Starbucks over Coffee Station is the quality of the coffee.     Still, me like very much.
The friendliest staff I have ever encountered in the service industry, period.  Great coffee and they are efficient.

I had an absolutely horrible experience today at this location.  I brought in 2 reams of multicolored neon documents that I had already printed and needed to be cut into 6 panels.  I dropped off the documents around noon and was promised the cuts to be completed by 4:30.  I arrived at 4:30 to find that 30% of the panels I needed cut out were ruined.  Completely cut through the printed area because the employee had mistakenly turned the first few sheets around the wrong direction so the rest of the ream was cut beyond correction.

They offered to reprint and use their own paper and claimed it was the same multi-color neon that I had purchased at office max for $30.  It turned out all of the colors were different and their prints all came out different sizes and were cropped horrible.  When I explained to the manager that the paper color was different from what I had purchased and the cuts were terrible, she blamed my printer for being inconsistent.

Guess what, all of the prints they made and cut were equally, if not worse than the ones I printed.  Bottom line is poor excuses for terrible work.

The woman who did the original cuts and made the mistake when home in the middle of the debacle and turned over the corrections to a nice young worker who was 'in training' according to his badge.

He spent the next 2.5 hours while I waited trying to reprint and recut the pages to correct the mistake but unfortunately he was not able to get the size and cuts consistent.  I ended up asking him to just print full pages and I had to buy a paper cutter and manually cut all of them so in addition to wasting about 3 hours in their store, I now had to spend another 50 dollar and spend the evening cutting them manually.
